content:
Hi, I took a university course on compilers and built a compiler as a project. I really enjoyed the experience and I'd like to start contributing to the Rust compiler.

I'm thinking a good spot to start on a LLVM related task. I've searched by A-LLVM on github and can see all the related issues. Was wondering if anyone who has more context and experience with the project has any recommendations of a good first issue to tackle.
Are you interested in contributing to rustc or to LLVM (in some way that benefits rustc)? A-LLVM issues are usually about issues in LLVM that affect rustc, and need to be addressed there.
